results.title: Airhawk: star of the north
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Colin Eggleston, Ron McLean and Ron McLean Productions
results.brief_description: Jim Hawk, outback pilot and adventurer, is wanted by a group of international diamond dealers. When he starts investigating his brother’s murder, Hawk finds himself on the hit list. Conspiracy and murder follow him from Hong Kong to the Gold Coast and then to outback Queensland, as Hawk struggles to uncover the ringleaders and avenge his brother’s death. Based on the cartoon series created by John Dixon the film stars Eric Oldfield and Louise Howitt.

results.title: Air parade: a Shell film for the Festival of Britain 1951
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: A brief history of aviation in Britain commencing with Bleriot’s crossing of the Channel in 1909 and ending with the development of the gas-turbine airliner. This film traces the development of both military and civil aircraft including the Viscount turbo-jet and the Comet.

results.title: Air Force One
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Petersen, Jonathan Shestack, Gail Katz, Armyan Bernstein and Buena Vista International
results.brief_description: Cementing his status as action hero leading man, Harrison Ford plays the United States President who also happens to be a Vietnam War hero. Trapped aboard his private jet, President Marshall must display a steely reserve in the face of unhinged kidnappers. Peterson (In the Line of Fire, The Perfect Storm, Troy) ably directs this mainstream thriller that produces a tangle of twists but lacks the enormous tension generated by his classic wartime nail-biter “Das Boot”. Cast also includes Gary Oldman, Wendy Crewson, Paul Guilfoyle, Glenn Close, Dean Stockwell, William H. Macy.

results.title: Aimee & Jaguar = Aimee and Jaguar
results.creator_credit: Max Farberbock, Gunter Rohrbach, Hanno Huth and Senator Film Production
results.brief_description: Based on the memoirs of Lilly Wust as recorded by Erica Fischer in her best-selling book, published in 1994, “Aimee and Jaguar” is a compelling love story that transgresses socially and politically imposed regulations around gender, race and culture. It tells the true story of two German women, one Jewish and one Aryan, who dared to fall deeply in love with each other at the height of the Holocaust. 1943- Lilly is a model bourgeois German mother of four children who indulges in affairs while husband is away fighting on the Eastern front. When she receives a love letter signed ‘Jaguar,’ she suspects a male admirer. But it is from the audacious Felice, a Jewish Resistance fighter, who initiates the passionate love affair that ignites between the two women amidst the bombing raids and anti-Semitic persecution. Inevitably it is a romance that is destined to end in tragedy. An immensely moving period drama, that also offers a visually impressive evocation of life in Berlin during WWII. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Aesop's fables. Volume 1
results.brief_description: Presented by Noni Hazelhurst, each of the Aesops fables (stories designed to teach a moral lesson) is brought to life by the use of beautifully illustrated full colour drawings of both the characters and their environment. The 18 stories on this tape are short and to the point. The tapes primary intent is to instruct rather than entertain, and short interludes between each story may be used by the teacher to generate discussion with the students on the stories they have just seen and heard. Fables include: The Fox and the crow ; The Goose and the golden eggs ; The Ant and the grasshopper ; The Lion and the mouse ; The Horse and the laden donkey ; The Lion and the bulls and The Vain crow.

results.title: Aileen Wuornos: the selling of a serial killer
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Broomfield, Rieta Oord and Lafayette Films
results.brief_description: Dubbed “America’s first female serial killer”, prostitute Aileen Wuornos killed seven men between 1990-91. While she claims self-defence and then is later persuaded by her “supporters” to change her plea, Broomfield skillfully reveals the layers of truth that surround the case. By implication, Broomfield disarmingly and ironically identifies himself as one of those attempting to gain from the “Wuornos Industry”.
results.title_for_label: Aileen Wuornos: the selling of a serial killer

results.title: Aids: what everyone needs to know [Revised] (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An authoritative exploration of AIDS produced in cooperation with the UCLA AIDS Centre. Discusses symptoms, transmission, diagnosis, how the body becomes prone to other diseases and the increasing danger to the general population. A family in which the husband has AIDS share their feelings.

results.title: Aerobics Down Under-Intermediate
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department
results.brief_description: The 30 minute Intermediate program has a more rigorous pace, and the exercises used are more demanding with fewer repetitions. The tape requires a good basic level of fitness, and assumes a level of flexibility and co-ordination such as would be developed through a consistent use of the Beginners Program. For many exercisers, and for elderly exercisers in particular, the intermediate program may be as far as they wish to go. Rated: G
